channel.title: attack.persistence on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in attack.persistence on My New Hugo Site

item.title: Suspicious MSExchangeMailboxReplication ASPX Write
item.description: Detects suspicious activity in which the MSExchangeMailboxReplication process writes .asp and .apsx files to disk, which could be a sign of ProxyShell exploitation

item.title: Rundll32 Registered COM Objects
item.description: load malicious registered COM objects

item.title: IE Change Domain Zone
item.description: Hides the file extension through modification of the registry

item.title: Registry Modification to Hidden File Extension
item.description: Hides the file extension through modification of the registry

item.title: Suspicious Get-WmiObject
item.description: The infrastructure for management data and operations that enables local and remote management of Windows personal computers and servers

item.title: Add Port Monitor Persistence in Registry
item.description: Adversaries may use port monitors to run an attacker supplied DLL during system boot for persistence or privilege escalation. A port monitor can be set through the AddMonitor API call to set a DLL to be loaded at startup.

item.title: Creation Exe for Service with Unquoted Path
item.description: Adversaries may execute their own malicious payloads by hijacking vulnerable file path references. Adversaries can take advantage of paths that lack surrounding quotations by placing an executable in a higher level directory within the path, so that Windows will choose the adversary’s executable to launch.

item.title: Registry Key Creation or Modification for Shim DataBase
item.description: Adversaries may establish persistence and/or elevate privileges by executing malicious content triggered by application shims. The Microsoft Windows Application Compatibility Infrastructure/Framework (Application Shim) was created to allow for backward compatibility of software as the operating system codebase changes over time

item.title: Registry-Free Process Scope COR_PROFILER
item.description: Adversaries may leverage the COR_PROFILER environment variable to hijack the execution flow of programs that load the .NET CLR. The COR_PROFILER is a .NET Framework feature which allows developers to specify an unmanaged (or external of .NET) profiling DLL to be loaded into each .NET process that loads the Common Language Runtime (CLR). These profiliers are designed to monitor, troubleshoot, and debug managed code executed by the .NET CLR. (Citation: Microsoft Profiling Mar 2017) (Citation: Microsoft COR_PROFILER Feb 2013)

item.title: Service ImagePath Change with Reg.exe
item.description: Adversaries may execute their own malicious payloads by hijacking the Registry entries used by services. Adversaries may use flaws in the permissions for registry to redirect from the originally specified executable to one that they control, in order to launch their own code at Service start. Windows stores local service configuration information in the Registry under HKLM\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services

item.title: Service Registry Permissions Weakness Check
item.description: Adversaries may execute their own malicious payloads by hijacking the Registry entries used by services. Adversaries may use flaws in the permissions for registry to redirect from the originally specified executable to one that they control, in order to launch their own code at Service start. Windows stores local service configuration information in the Registry under HKLM\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services

item.title: Winlogon Notify Key Logon Persistence
item.description: Adversaries may abuse features of Winlogon to execute DLLs and/or executables when a user logs in. Winlogon.exe is a Windows component responsible for actions at logon/logoff as well as the secure attention sequence (SAS) triggered by Ctrl-Alt-Delete.

item.title: Change Outlook Security Setting in Registry
item.description: Change outlook email security settings

item.title: Code Executed Via Office Add-in XLL File
item.description: Adversaries may abuse Microsoft Office add-ins to obtain persistence on a compromised system. Office add-ins can be used to add functionality to Office programs

item.title: Manipulation of User Computer or Group Security Principals Across AD
item.description: Adversaries may create a domain account to maintain access to victim systems. Domain accounts are those managed by Active Directory Domain Services where access and permissions are configured across systems and services that are part of that domain..

item.title: New Shim Database Created in the Default Directory
item.description: Adversaries may establish persistence and/or elevate privileges by executing malicious content triggered by application shims. The Microsoft Windows Application Compatibility Infrastructure/Framework (Application Shim) was created to allow for backward compatibility of software as the operating system codebase changes over time.

item.title: Powershell Create Scheduled Task
item.description: Adversaries may abuse the Windows Task Scheduler to perform task scheduling for initial or recurring execution of malicious code

item.title: Powershell LocalAccount Manipulation
item.description: Adversaries may manipulate accounts to maintain access to victim systems. Account manipulation may consist of any action that preserves adversary access to a compromised account, such as modifying credentials or permission groups

item.title: Running Chrome VPN Extensions via the Registry 2 VPN Extension
item.description: Running Chrome VPN Extensions via the Registry install 2 vpn extension

item.title: Suspicious Screensaver Binary File Creation
item.description: Adversaries may establish persistence by executing malicious content triggered by user inactivity. Screensavers are programs that execute after a configurable time of user inactivity and consist of Portable Executable (PE) files with a .scr file extension

item.title: Abuse of Service Permissions to Hide Services in Tools
item.description: Detection of sc.exe utility adding a new service with special permission which hides that service.

item.title: Shells Spawn by Java
item.description: Detects shell spawn from Java host process, which could a maintenance task or some kind of exploitation (e.g. log4j exploitation)

item.title: Suspicious Shells Spawn by Java
item.description: Detects suspicious shell spawn from Java host process (e.g. log4j exploitation)

item.title: Suspicious Shells Spawn by Java Utility Keytool
item.description: Detects suspicious shell spawn from Java utility keytool process (e.g. adselfservice plus exploitation)

item.title: Azure Kubernetes Admission Controller
item.description: Identifies when an admission controller is executed in Azure Kubernetes. A Kubernetes Admission controller intercepts, and possibly modifies, requests to the Kubernetes API server. The behavior of this admission controller is determined by an admission webhook (MutatingAdmissionWebhook or ValidatingAdmissionWebhook) that the user deploys in the cluster. An adversary can use such webhooks as the MutatingAdmissionWebhook for obtaining persistence in the cluster. For example, attackers can intercept and modify the pod creation operations in the cluster and add their malicious container to every created pod. An adversary can use the webhook ValidatingAdmissionWebhook, which could be used to obtain access credentials. An adversary could use the webhook to intercept the requests to the API server, record secrets, and other sensitive information.

item.title: Google Cloud Kubernetes Admission Controller
item.description: Identifies when an admission controller is executed in GCP Kubernetes. A Kubernetes Admission controller intercepts, and possibly modifies, requests to the Kubernetes API server. The behavior of this admission controller is determined by an admission webhook (MutatingAdmissionWebhook or ValidatingAdmissionWebhook) that the user deploys in the cluster. An adversary can use such webhooks as the MutatingAdmissionWebhook for obtaining persistence in the cluster. For example, attackers can intercept and modify the pod creation operations in the cluster and add their malicious container to every created pod. An adversary can use the webhook ValidatingAdmissionWebhook, which could be used to obtain access credentials. An adversary could use the webhook to intercept the requests to the API server, record secrets, and other sensitive information.

item.title: Azure Kubernetes CronJob
item.description: Identifies when a Azure Kubernetes CronJob runs in Azure Cloud. Kubernetes Job is a controller that creates one or more pods and ensures that a specified number of them successfully terminate. Kubernetes Job can be used to run containers that perform finite tasks for batch jobs. Kubernetes CronJob is used to schedule Jobs. An Adversary may use Kubernetes CronJob for scheduling execution of malicious code that would run as a container in the cluster.

item.title: Google Cloud Kubernetes CronJob
item.description: Identifies when a Google Cloud Kubernetes CronJob runs in Azure Cloud. Kubernetes Job is a controller that creates one or more pods and ensures that a specified number of them successfully terminate. Kubernetes Job can be used to run containers that perform finite tasks for batch jobs. Kubernetes CronJob is used to schedule Jobs. An Adversary may use Kubernetes CronJob for scheduling execution of malicious code that would run as a container in the cluster.

item.title: Registry Persistence Mechanisms in Recycle Bin
item.description: Detects persistence registry keys for Recycle Bin

item.title: Suspicious Scheduled Task Write to System32 Tasks
item.description: Detects the creation of tasks from processes executed from suspicious locations

item.title: Cron Files
item.description: Detects creation of cron files or files in Cron directories. Potential persistence.

item.title: Linux Webshell Indicators
item.description: Detects suspicious sub processes of web server processes

item.title: Suspicious Driver Install by pnputil.exe
item.description: Detects when a possible suspicious driver is being installed via pnputil.exe lolbin

item.title: User Added to an Administrator's Azure AD Role
item.description: User Added to an Administrator’s Azure AD Role

item.title: Chafer Activity
item.description: Detects Chafer activity attributed to OilRig as reported in Nyotron report in March 2018

item.title: Okta MFA Reset or Deactivated
item.description: Detects when an attempt at deactivating or resetting MFA.

item.title: Okta API Token Created
item.description: Detects when a API token is created

item.title: CVE-2021-40539 Zoho ManageEngine ADSelfService Plus Exploit
item.description: Detects an authentication bypass vulnerability affecting the REST API URLs in ADSelfService Plus (CVE-2021-40539).

item.title: Google Workspace Granted Domain API Access
item.description: Detects when an API access service account is granted domain authority.

item.title: Google Workspace User Granted Admin Privileges
item.description: Detects when an Google Workspace user is granted admin privileges.

item.title: Certificate Request Export to Exchange Webserver
item.description: Detects a write of an Exchange CSR to an untypical directory or with aspx name suffix which can be used to place a webshell

item.title: Powerup Write Hijack DLL
item.description: Powerup tool’s Write Hijack DLL exploits DLL hijacking for privilege escalation. In it’s default mode, it builds a self deleting .bat file which executes malicious command. The detection rule relies on creation of the malicious bat file (debug.bat by default).

item.title: Suspicious Bitstransfer via PowerShell
item.description: Detects transferring files from system on a server bitstransfer Powershell cmdlets

item.title: Mailbox Export to Exchange Webserver
item.description: Detects a successful export of an Exchange mailbox to untypical directory or with aspx name suffix which can be used to place a webshell or the needed role assignment for it

item.title: AWS ElastiCache Security Group Created
item.description: Detects when an ElastiCache security group has been created.

item.title: AWS Route 53 Domain Transfer Lock Disabled
item.description: Detects when a transfer lock was removed from a Route 53 domain. It is recommended to refrain from performing this action unless intending to transfer the domain to a different registrar.

item.title: AWS Route 53 Domain Transferred to Another Account
item.description: Detects when a request has been made to transfer a Route 53 domain to another AWS account.

item.title: SOURGUM Actor Behaviours
item.description: Suspicious behaviours related to an actor tracked by Microsoft as SOURGUM

item.title: Serv-U Exploitation CVE-2021-35211 by DEV-0322
item.description: Detects patterns as noticed in exploitation of Serv-U CVE-2021-35211 vulnerability by threat group DEV-0322

item.title: Outlook C2 Registry Key
item.description: Detects the modification of Outlook Security Setting to allow unprompted execution. Goes with win_outlook_c2_macro_creation.yml and is particularly interesting if both events occur near to each other.

item.title: Stealthy VSTO Persistence
item.description: Detects persistence via Visual Studio Tools for Office (VSTO) add-ins in Office applications.

item.title: Solarwinds SUPERNOVA Webshell Access
item.description: Detects access to SUPERNOVA webshell as described in Guidepoint report

item.title: Suspicious Shells Spawn by SQL Server
item.description: Detects suspicious shell spawn from MSSQL process, this might be sight of RCE or SQL Injection

item.title: AWS User Login Profile Was Modified
item.description: An attacker with the iam:UpdateLoginProfile permission on other users can change the password used to login to the AWS console on any user that already has a login profile setup. With this alert, it is used to detect anyone is changing password on behalf of other users.

item.title: WINEKEY Registry Modification
item.description: Detects potential malicious modification of run keys by winekey or team9 backdoor

item.title: Office Application Startup - Office Test
item.description: Detects the addition of office test registry that allows a user to specify an arbitrary DLL that will be executed every time an Office application is started

item.title: Setuid and Setgid
item.description: Detects suspicious change of file privileges with chown and chmod commands

item.title: Suspicious New Printer Ports in Registry (CVE-2020-1048)
item.description: Detects a new and suspicious printer port creation in Registry that could be an attempt to exploit CVE-2020-1048

item.title: Windows Registry Persistence COM Search Order Hijacking
item.description: Detects potential COM object hijacking leveraging the COM Search Order

item.title: PowerShell Create Local User
item.description: Detects creation of a local user via PowerShell

item.title: Suspicious desktop.ini Action
item.description: Detects unusual processes accessing desktop.ini, which can be leveraged to alter how Explorer displays a folder’s content (i.e. renaming files) without changing them on disk.

item.title: AWS IAM Backdoor Users Keys
item.description: Detects AWS API key creation for a user by another user. Backdoored users can be used to obtain persistence in the AWS environment. Also with this alert, you can detect a flow of AWS keys in your org.

item.title: Tasks Folder Evasion
item.description: The Tasks folder in system32 and syswow64 are globally writable paths. Adversaries can take advantage of this and load or influence any script hosts or ANY .NET Application in Tasks to load and execute a custom assembly into cscript, wscript, regsvr32, mshta, eventvwr

item.title: Ryuk Ransomware
item.description: Detects Ryuk ransomware activity

item.title: Cisco Local Accounts
item.description: Find local accounts being created or modified as well as remote authentication configurations

item.title: Cisco Modify Configuration
item.description: Modifications to a config that will serve an adversary’s impacts or persistence

item.title: Direct Autorun Keys Modification
item.description: Detects direct modification of autostart extensibility point (ASEP) in registry using reg.exe.

item.title: Suspicious Windows ANONYMOUS LOGON Local Account Created
item.description: Detects the creation of suspicious accounts similar to ANONYMOUS LOGON, such as using additional spaces. Created as an covering detection for exclusion of Logon Type 3 from ANONYMOUS LOGON accounts.

item.title: Change Default File Association
item.description: When a file is opened, the default program used to open the file (also called the file association or handler) is checked. File association selections are stored in the Windows Registry and can be edited by users, administrators, or programs that have Registry access or by administrators using the built-in assoc utility. Applications can modify the file association for a given file extension to call an arbitrary program when a file with the given extension is opened.

item.title: Svchost DLL Search Order Hijack
item.description: IKEEXT and SessionEnv service, as they call LoadLibrary on files that do not exist within C:\Windows\System32\ by default. An attacker can place their malicious logic within the PROCESS_ATTACH block of their library and restart the aforementioned services “svchost.exe -k netsvcs” to gain code execution on a remote machine.

item.title: Net.exe User Account Creation
item.description: Identifies creation of local users via the net.exe command.

item.title: Suspicious Bitsadmin Job via PowerShell
item.description: Detect download by BITS jobs via PowerShell

item.title: Possible Privilege Escalation via Weak Service Permissions
item.description: Detection of sc.exe utility spawning by user with Medium integrity level to change service ImagePath or FailureCommand

item.title: Windows Registry Persistence COM Key Linking
item.description: Detects COM object hijacking via TreatAs subkey

item.title: Narrator's Feedback-Hub Persistence
item.description: Detects abusing Windows 10 Narrator’s Feedback-Hub

item.title: Suspicious Service Path Modification
item.description: Detects service path modification to PowerShell or cmd.

item.title: Powershell Profile.ps1 Modification
item.description: Detects a change in profile.ps1 of the Powershell profile

item.title: Winlogon Helper DLL
item.description: Winlogon.exe is a Windows component responsible for actions at logon/logoff as well as the secure attention sequence (SAS) triggered by Ctrl-Alt-Delete. Registry entries in HKLM\Software[Wow6432Node]Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Winlogon\ and HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Winlogon\ are used to manage additional helper programs and functionalities that support Winlogon. Malicious modifications to these Registry keys may cause Winlogon to load and execute malicious DLLs and/or executables.

item.title: Systemd Service Reload or Start
item.description: Detects a reload or a start of a service.

item.title: Webshell Remote Command Execution
item.description: Detects possible command execution by web application/web shell

item.title: DLL Load via LSASS
item.description: Detects a method to load DLL via LSASS process using an undocumented Registry key

item.title: WMI Backdoor Exchange Transport Agent
item.description: Detects a WMI backdoor in Exchange Transport Agents via WMI event filters

item.title: Control Panel Items
item.description: Detects the malicious use of a control panel item

item.title: Edit of .bash_profile and .bashrc
item.description: Detects change of user environment. Adversaries can insert code into these files to gain persistence each time a user logs in or opens a new shell.

item.title: Local User Creation
item.description: Detects local user creation on windows servers, which shouldn’t happen in an Active Directory environment. Apply this Sigma Use Case on your windows server logs and not on your DC logs.

item.title: Execution in Webserver Root Folder
item.description: Detects a suspicious program execution in a web service root folder (filter out false positives)

item.title: IIS Native-Code Module Command Line Installation
item.description: Detects suspicious IIS native-code module installations via command line

item.title: Possible Shim Database Persistence via sdbinst.exe
item.description: Detects installation of a new shim using sdbinst.exe. A shim can be used to load malicious DLLs into applications.

item.title: Scheduled Task Creation
item.description: Detects the creation of scheduled tasks in user session

item.title: Shells Spawned by Web Servers
item.description: Web servers that spawn shell processes could be the result of a successfully placed web shell or an other attack

item.title: WMI Persistence - Script Event Consumer
item.description: Detects WMI script event consumers

item.title: WMI Event Subscription
item.description: Detects creation of WMI event subscription persistence method

item.title: Logon Scripts (UserInitMprLogonScript)
item.description: Detects creation or execution of UserInitMprLogonScript persistence method

item.title: Turla PNG Dropper Service
item.description: This method detects malicious services mentioned in Turla PNG dropper report by NCC Group in November 2018

item.title: Oracle WebLogic Exploit
item.description: Detects access to a webshell dropped into a keystore folder on the WebLogic server

item.title: Default PowerSploit and Empire Schtasks Persistence
item.description: Detects the creation of a schtask via PowerSploit or Empire Default Configuration.

item.title: Sticky Key Like Backdoor Usage
item.description: Detects the usage and installation of a backdoor that uses an option to register a malicious debugger for built-in tools that are accessible in the login screen

item.title: Defrag Deactivation
item.description: Detects the deactivation and disabling of the Scheduled defragmentation task as seen by Slingshot APT group

item.title: WMI Persistence
item.description: Detects suspicious WMI event filter and command line event consumer based on WMI and Security Logs.

item.title: Turla Service Install
item.description: This method detects a service install of malicious services mentioned in Carbon Paper - Turla report by ESET

item.title: Shellshock Expression
item.description: Detects shellshock expressions in log files

item.title: User Added to Local Administrators
item.description: This rule triggers on user accounts that are added to the local Administrators group, which could be legitimate activity or a sign of privilege escalation activity

item.title: Addition of SID History to Active Directory Object
item.description: An attacker can use the SID history attribute to gain additional privileges.

item.title: Password Change on Directory Service Restore Mode (DSRM) Account
item.description: The Directory Service Restore Mode (DSRM) account is a local administrator account on Domain Controllers. Attackers may change the password to gain persistence.

item.title: Suspicious Driver Load from Temp
item.description: Detects a driver load from a temporary directory

item.title: Webshell Detection by Keyword
item.description: Detects webshells that use GET requests by keyword searches in URL strings

item.title: Failed Logins with Different Accounts from Single Source System
item.description: Detects suspicious failed logins with different user accounts from a single source system

item.title: Account Tampering - Suspicious Failed Logon Reasons
item.description: This method uses uncommon error codes on failed logons to determine suspicious activity and tampering with accounts that have been disabled or somehow restricted.

item.title: Abusing Windows Telemetry For Persistence
item.description: Windows telemetry makes use of the binary CompatTelRunner.exe to run a variety of commands and perform the actual telemetry collections. This binary was created to be easily extensible, and to that end, it relies on the registry to instruct on which commands to run. The problem is, it will run any arbitrary command without restriction of location or type.

item.title: Abusing Windows Telemetry For Persistence
item.description: Windows telemetry makes use of the binary CompatTelRunner.exe to run a variety of commands and perform the actual telemetry collections. This binary was created to be easily extensible, and to that end, it relies on the registry to instruct on which commands to run. The problem is, it will run any arbitrary command without restriction of location or type.

item.title: Addition of Domain Trusts
item.description: Addition of domains is seldom and should be verified for legitimacy.

item.title: Atbroker Registry Change
item.description: Detects creation/modification of Assisitive Technology applications and persistence with usage of ATs

item.title: Bitsadmin Download
item.description: Detects usage of bitsadmin downloading a file

item.title: Bitsadmin to Uncommon TLD
item.description: Detects Bitsadmin connections to domains with uncommon TLDs - https://twitter.com/jhencinski/status/1102695118455349248 - https://isc.sans.edu/forums/diary/Investigating+Microsoft+BITS+Activity/23281/

item.title: Bypass UAC Using Event Viewer
item.description: Bypasses User Account Control using Event Viewer and a relevant Windows Registry modification

item.title: Changing RDP Port to Non Standard Number
item.description: Remote desktop is a common feature in operating systems. It allows a user to log into an interactive session with a system desktop graphical user interface on a remote system. Microsoft refers to its implementation of the Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP) as Remote Desktop Services (RDS).

item.title: Code Injection by ld.so Preload
item.description: Detects the ld.so preload persistence file. See man ld.so for more information.

item.title: Creation of a Local Hidden User Account by Registry
item.description: Sysmon registry detection of a local hidden user account.

item.title: Creation Of A Local User Account
item.description: Detects the creation of a new user account. Such accounts may be used for persistence that do not require persistent remote access tools to be deployed on the system.

item.title: Creation Of An User Account
item.description: Detects the creation of a new user account. Such accounts may be used for persistence that do not require persistent remote access tools to be deployed on the system.

item.title: DEWMODE Webshell Access
item.description: Detects access to DEWMODE webshell as described in FIREEYE report

item.title: Disabled MFA to Bypass Authentication Mechanisms
item.description: Detection for when multi factor authentication has been disabled, which might indicate a malicious activity to bypass authentication mechanisms.

item.title: DNS HybridConnectionManager Service Bus
item.description: Detects Azure Hybrid Connection Manager services querying the Azure service bus service

item.title: Enabled User Right in AD to Control User Objects
item.description: Detects scenario where if a user is assigned the SeEnableDelegationPrivilege right in Active Directory it would allow control of other AD user objects.

item.title: Enabling COR Profiler Environment Variables
item.description: This rule detects cor_enable_profiling and cor_profiler environment variables being set and configured.

item.title: Exchange Exploitation Activity
item.description: Detects activity observed by different researchers to be HAFNIUM group activity (or related) on Exchange servers

item.title: Exchange Set OabVirtualDirectory ExternalUrl Property
item.description: Rule to detect an adversary setting OabVirtualDirectory External URL property to a script in Exchange Management log

item.title: Failed MSExchange Transport Agent Installation
item.description: Detects a failed installation of a Exchange Transport Agent

item.title: Fax Service DLL Search Order Hijack
item.description: The Fax service attempts to load ualapi.dll, which is non-existent. An attacker can then (side)load their own malicious DLL using this service.

item.title: Hidden Local User Creation
item.description: Detects the creation of a local hidden user account which should not happen for event ID 4720.

item.title: HybridConnectionManager Service Installation
item.description: Rule to detect the Hybrid Connection Manager service installation.

item.title: HybridConnectionManager Service Running
item.description: Rule to detect the Hybrid Connection Manager service running on an endpoint.

item.title: Leviathan Registry Key Activity
item.description: Detects registry key used by Leviathan APT in Malaysian focused campaign

item.title: Loading of Kernel Module via Insmod
item.description: Detects loading of kernel modules with insmod command. Loadable Kernel Modules (LKMs) are pieces of code that can be loaded and unloaded into the kernel upon demand. Adversaries may use LKMs to obtain persistence within the system or elevate the privileges.

item.title: Logon Scripts (UserInitMprLogonScript) Registry
item.description: Detects creation or execution of UserInitMprLogonScript persistence method

item.title: MacOS Emond Launch Daemon
item.description: Detects additions to the Emond Launch Daemon that adversaries may use to gain persistence and elevate privileges.

item.title: Microsoft Office Add-In Loading
item.description: Detects add-ins that load when Microsoft Word or Excel starts (.wll/.xll are simply .dll fit for Word or Excel).

item.title: MITRE BZAR Indicators for Persistence
item.description: Windows DCE-RPC functions which indicate a persistence techniques on the remote system. All credit for the Zeek mapping of the suspicious endpoint/operation field goes to MITRE.

item.title: Modification Of Existing Services For Persistence
item.description: Detects modification of an existing service on a compromised host in order to execute an arbitrary payload when the service is started or killed as a method of persistence.

item.title: Moriya Rootkit
item.description: Detects the use of Moriya rootkit as described in the securelist’s Operation TunnelSnake report

item.title: MSExchange Transport Agent Installation
item.description: Detects the Installation of a Exchange Transport Agent

item.title: New Federated Domain Added
item.description: Alert for the addition of a new federated domain.

item.title: New TaskCache Entry
item.description: Monitor the creation of a new key under ‘TaskCache’ when a new scheduled task is registered

item.title: Outlook C2 Macro Creation
item.description: Detects the creation of a macro file for Outlook. Goes with win_outlook_c2_registry_key. VbaProject.OTM is explicitly mentioned in T1137. Particularly interesting if both events Registry & File Creation happens at the same time.

item.title: Outlook Form Installation
item.description: Detects the creation of new Outlook form which can contain malicious code

item.title: Path To Screensaver Binary Modified
item.description: Detects value modification of registry key containing path to binary used as screensaver.

item.title: Persistence and Execution at Scale via GPO Scheduled Task
item.description: Detect lateral movement using GPO scheduled task, usually used to deploy ransomware at scale

item.title: Persistent Outlook Landing Pages
item.description: Detects the manipulation of persistent URLs which could execute malicious code

item.title: Persistent Outlook Landing Pages
item.description: Detects the manipulation of persistent URLs which can be malicious

item.title: Pingback Backdoor
item.description: Detects the use of Pingback backdoor that creates ICMP tunnel for C2 as described in the trustwave report

item.title: Pingback Backdoor
item.description: Detects the use of Pingback backdoor that creates ICMP tunnel for C2 as described in the trustwave report

item.title: Pingback Backdoor
item.description: Detects the use of Pingback backdoor that creates ICMP tunnel for C2 as described in the trustwave report

item.title: Possible Ransomware or Unauthorized MBR Modifications
item.description: Detects, possibly, malicious unauthorized usage of bcdedit.exe

item.title: Powerview Add-DomainObjectAcl DCSync AD Extend Right
item.description: backdooring domain object to grant the rights associated with DCSync to a regular user or machine account using Powerview\Add-DomainObjectAcl DCSync Extended Right cmdlet, will allow to re-obtain the pwd hashes of any user/computer

item.title: Reg Add RUN Key
item.description: Detects suspicious command line reg.exe tool adding key to RUN key in Registry

item.title: Registry Persistence Mechanism via Windows Telemetry
item.description: Detects persistence method using windows telemetry

item.title: Remote Service Activity via SVCCTL Named Pipe
item.description: Detects remote service activity via remote access to the svcctl named pipe

item.title: Remote Task Creation via ATSVC Named Pipe
item.description: Detects remote task creation via at.exe or API interacting with ATSVC namedpipe

item.title: Remote Task Creation via ATSVC Named Pipe - Zeek
item.description: Detects remote task creation via at.exe or API interacting with ATSVC namedpipe

item.title: Remote WMI ActiveScriptEventConsumers
item.description: Detect potential adversaries leveraging WMI ActiveScriptEventConsumers remotely to move laterally in a network

item.title: Scheduled Cron Task/Job
item.description: Detects abuse of the cron utility to perform task scheduling for initial or recurring execution of malicious code. Detection will focus on crontab jobs uploaded from the tmp folder.

item.title: Scheduled Cron Task/Job
item.description: Detects abuse of the cron utility to perform task scheduling for initial or recurring execution of malicious code. Detection will focus on crontab jobs uploaded from the tmp folder.

item.title: Scheduled Task/Job At
item.description: Detects the use of at/atd

item.title: ServiceDll Modification
item.description: Detects the modification of a ServiceDLL value in the service settings

item.title: SilentProcessExit Monitor Registrytion
item.description: Detects changes to the Registry in which a monitor program gets registered to monitor the exit of another process

item.title: Startup Folder File Write
item.description: A General detection for files being created in the Windows startup directory. This could be an indicator of persistence.

item.title: Startup Items
item.description: Detects creation of startup item plist files that automatically get executed at boot initialization to establish persistence.

item.title: StoneDrill Service Install
item.description: This method detects a service install of the malicious Microsoft Network Realtime Inspection Service service described in StoneDrill report by Kaspersky

item.title: Suspicious Add User to Remote Desktop Users Group
item.description: Detects suspicious command line in which a user gets added to the local Remote Desktop Users group

item.title: Suspicious Debugger Registration Cmdline
item.description: Detects the registration of a debugger for a program that is available in the logon screen (sticky key backdoor).

item.title: Suspicious Download File Extension with Bits
item.description: Adversaries may abuse BITS jobs to persistently execute or clean up after malicious payloads. Windows Background Intelligent Transfer Service (BITS) is a low-bandwidth, asynchronous file transfer mechanism exposed through Component Object Model

item.title: Suspicious Encoded Scripts in a WMI Consumer
item.description: Detects suspicious encoded payloads in WMI Event Consumers

item.title: Suspicious PowerShell Mailbox Export to Share
item.description: Detects a PowerShell New-MailboxExportRequest that exports a mailbox to a local share, as used in ProxyShell exploitations

item.title: Suspicious PrinterPorts Creation (CVE-2020-1048)
item.description: Detects new commands that add new printer port which point to suspicious file

item.title: Suspicious Run Key from Download
item.description: Detects the suspicious RUN keys created by software located in Download or temporary Outlook/Internet Explorer directories

item.title: Suspicious Scheduled Task Creation Involving Temp Folder
item.description: Detects the creation of scheduled tasks that involves a temporary folder and runs only once

item.title: Suspicious Service DACL Modification
item.description: Detects suspicious DACL modifications that can be used to hide services or make them unstopable

item.title: Suspicious Shells Spawn by WinRM
item.description: Detects suspicious shell spawn from WinRM host process

item.title: Suspicious Task Added by Bitsadmin
item.description: Adversaries may abuse BITS jobs to persistently execute or clean up after malicious payloads. Windows Background Intelligent Transfer Service (BITS) is a low-bandwidth, asynchronous file transfer mechanism exposed through Component Object Model

item.title: Suspicious Task Added by Powershell
item.description: Adversaries may abuse BITS jobs to persistently execute or clean up after malicious payloads. Windows Background Intelligent Transfer Service (BITS) is a low-bandwidth, asynchronous file transfer mechanism exposed through Component Object Model

item.title: Suspicious VBScript UN2452 Pattern
item.description: Detects suspicious inline VBScript keywords as used by UNC2452

item.title: Suspicious WMIC ActiveScriptEventConsumer Creation
item.description: Detects WMIC executions in which a event consumer gets created in order to establish persistence

item.title: Systemd Service Creation
item.description: Detects a creation of systemd services which could be used by adversaries to execute malicious code.

item.title: UAC Bypass With Fake DLL
item.description: Attempts to load dismcore.dll after dropping it

item.title: VBScript Payload Stored in Registry
item.description: Detects VBScript content stored into registry keys as seen being used by UNC2452 group

item.title: VMToolsd Suspicious Child Process
item.description: Detects suspicious child process creations of VMware Tools process which may indicate persistence setup

item.title: Webshell ReGeorg Detection Via Web Logs
item.description: Certain strings in the uri_query field when combined with null referer and null user agent can indicate activity associated with the webshell ReGeorg.

item.title: Windows Network Access Suspicious desktop.ini Action
item.description: Detects unusual processes accessing desktop.ini remotely over network share, which can be leveraged to alter how Explorer displays a folder’s content (i.e. renaming files) without changing them on disk.

item.title: Windows Spooler Service Suspicious Binary Load
item.description: Detect DLL Load from Spooler Service backup folder

item.title: Windows Spooler Service Suspicious File Deletion
item.description: Detect DLL deletions from Spooler Service driver folder

item.title: WMI Persistence - Command Line Event Consumer
item.description: Detects WMI command line event consumers

item.title: WMI Persistence - Script Event Consumer File Write
item.description: Detects file writes of WMI script event consumer

item.title: WMI Script Host Process Image Loaded
item.description: Detects signs of the WMI script host process %SystemRoot%\system32\wbem\scrcons.exe functionality being used via images being loaded by a process.

item.title: Writing Of Malicious Files To The Fonts Folder
item.description: Monitors for the hiding possible malicious files in the C:\Windows\Fonts\ location. This folder doesn’t require admin privillege to be written and executed from.
